# German Society for the Exploration of Palestine

, the society's biannual peer-reviewed publication]]
The German Association for the Exploration of Palestine (; ) also known as the German Palestine Society () was founded in 1877 to promote the scientific study of the history and culture of Palestine, especially its Biblical past. Its headquarters were in Leipzig, and its current headquarters are in Bonn.
It was founded by  on September 28, 1877, by , Albert Socin, and Emil Friedrich Kautzsch.
